title: Pune R UseR Group
text:
What is Pune R UseR Group?
We are a group of R enthusiasts aiming to provide a platform for anyone interested to learn, share, discuss R as a programming language and its application.

title: Mission
text: Fostering learning, collaboration, and community around the R programming language.

title: Introduction to Shiny
text:
Shiny is an R package that allows you to build interactive web applications without needing to learn HTML, CSS, or JavaScript. Whether youâ€™re a data scientist, researcher, or business analyst, Shiny helps transform static reports into dynamic, web-based applications.
With just a few lines of R code, you can create dashboards, visualize live data, and interact with datasets in real time.



Hereâ€™s why Shiny is a game-changer for R programmers:
âœ… Easy to Get Started â€“ No need for web development skills, if you know coding in R that is enough to get started in Shiny.
âœ… Interactivity â€“ Users can manipulate data and see updates instantly
âœ… Data Visualization â€“ Generate interactive plots and tables effortlessly
âœ… Deploy Anywhere â€“ Publish apps online with platforms like ShinyApps.io which is easy to share with others.



Shiny apps are structured in three main ways:
1ï¸âƒ£ Single File (app.R) â€“ Everything (UI + server) is written in a single file.
2ï¸âƒ£ Separate Files (ui.R & server.R) â€“ UI and backend logic are split into different files.
3ï¸âƒ£ Shiny Frameworks (Golem, Rhino) â€“ For advanced Shiny applications with modular structures.



Shinyâ€™s reactivity makes apps dynamic. It works by updating outputs whenever inputs change.
Reactivity in Shiny can be seen in different forms :
ğŸ”¹ Reactive Inputs â€“ User-provided values (e.g., text boxes, dropdowns)
ğŸ”¹ Reactive Expressions â€“ Automatically recalculates when inputs change
ğŸ”¹ Reactive Outputs â€“ Dynamically updates tables, plots, and text based on inputs
ğŸ”¹ Observers â€“ Executes actions (e.g., saving a file) without returning a value



Here are some real-world Shiny apps:
ğŸ”¹ Basic Apps â€“ Example 1
ğŸ”¹ Advanced Dashboards â€“ COVID-19 Dashboard
ğŸ”¹ Creative Uses â€“ TidyTuesday App



Once your app is ready, you can publish it on:
ğŸ“Œ ShinyApps.io â€“ A free hosting platform (up to 5 apps, 25 active hours)
ğŸ“Œ RStudio Connect â€“ Enterprise-level hosting for Shiny apps



Want to dive deeper into Shiny? Check out these resources:
ğŸ“– Shiny Official Docs
ğŸ“– Mastering Shiny
ğŸ“– Shiny Gallery



Shiny is a powerful tool for turning R scripts into interactive web applications. Whether youâ€™re analyzing data, building dashboards, or sharing insights, Shiny makes it simple and accessible.
This post is inspired by Pune R UseR Group (Pune RUG) talk on Introduction to Shiny and the resources used for the talk can be accessed on Github.
Are you ready to build your first Shiny app? Letâ€™s get started! ğŸš€
